title: Question 1
question: The upper limbs are composed of 04 segments, which are:

options.label: Cingulate of the upper limb, arm, forearm and hand
Cingulate of the upper limb, arm, forearm and fingers

question: Which cingulate of the upper limb is formed by bones?

title: Question 3
question: Which bones and arms are composed respectively by bones?

question: As for the location, the ulna bone is found:

question: Of the following structures, which is not located in the clavicle bone?

title: Question 8
question: The carpal bones in the proximal row, from lateral to medial, are respectively:

question: The carpal bones of the distal row, from lateral to medial, are respectively:

title: Question 10
question: The skeleton of the hand is composed of metacarpal bones. Among the alternatives below, which one is correct?

options.label: There are 05 bones, the 1st metacarpal bone being the thickest and shortest of the metacarpal bones
There are 10 bones, the 5th metacarpal bone being the thickest and shortest of the metacarpal bones
There are 5 bones, the 1st metacarpal bone being the thinnest and longest of the metacarpal bones
There are 10 bones, and the 5th metacarpal bone is the thinnest and longest of the metacarpal bones

title: Question 11
question: Which of the following nerves does not participate in the innervation of the upper limbs?

title: Question 12
question: Which of the following veins is not part of the vascularization of the upper limbs?

title: Question 13
question: Of the following muscles, which is not part of the upper limbs?

title: Question 14
question: The armpit is subdivided into 06 parts, which are:

options.label: Top, base, left side wall, right side wall, central region and thoracic portion
Top, base, left side wall, right side wall, intimate wall and central wall
Apex, base, anterior wall, posterior wall, medial wall and lateral wall
Apex, base, bottom wall, top wall, side wall and medial wall

title: Question 15
question: Which artery is a continuation of the axillary artery?

options.label: Subclavian artery continuation, starting at the lateral margin of the 1st rib, and ending at the lower margin of the teres major muscle
Continuation of the subclavian artery, starting at the lateral margin of the 3rd rib, and ending at the lower margin of the teres minor muscle
Continuation of the thoracoacromial artery, starting at the margin of the 1st rib, and ending at the lower margin of the teres minor muscle
Continuation of the thoracoacromial artery, beginning at the margin of the 3rd rib, and ending at the lower margin of the teres major muscle

title: Question 16
question: Of the following arteries, which is not a branch of the axillary artery?

title: Question 17
question: Which of the following arteries is not part of the vascularization of the upper limb?

title: Question 18
question: With respect to the brachial plexus, it is formed by which branches of nerves?

options.label: Formed by the union of the posterior branches of the nerves C5 to C7, and by the smaller part of the anterior branch of T2
Formed by the union of the anterior branches of nerves C5 to C8 and most of the anterior branch of T1
Formed by the union of the posterior branches of nerves C4 to C7, and most of the posterior branch of T1
Formed by the union of the anterior branches of the nerves from C3 to C8, and by most of the posterior branch of T2

title: Question 19
question: Of the nerves below, which is not part of the innervation of the upper limbs?

title: Question 20
question: Which of the following muscles is not part of the arm?
